intro: Wendlandia oligantha, commonly known as the silverleaf waterwheel, is a strikingly beautiful plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features palmate leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
